intro: Microcoelia bispiculata, commonly known as the two-spined microcoelia, is a rare and delicate flowering plant native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes parsley and carrots, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in umbels, typical of its family. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in mountainous regions. Due to habitat loss, it is considered endangered and requires conservation efforts to ensure its survival.
